paper_abstract: A new paradigm called parallel multi-recipient signcryption is proposed, which enhances the performance sharply when a sender sends distinct messages to multiple recipients in imbalanced wireless networks. The framework including syntax, architecture and security model is presented. Randomness reusing and cipher text aggregation are used to reduce the computation and transmission overheads on the sender node. A parallel multi-recipient scheme called ParaSC-GDH is proposed also, which is semantic secure. When n messages are processed with ParaSC-GDH on the N cores (threads) system, the theoretic speedup is up to N and the communication overheads is (4n+3)/7n of traditional ways. An experiment result shows that, the improvement of CPU time and cipher text size are 48.6% and 42.8% when it processes 1,000 distinct messages. As the number of recipients growing, the improvements increase also.
paper_title: PARALLEL MULTI-RECIPIENT SIGNCRYPTION FOR IMBALANCED WIRELESS NETWORKS
